clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the treatment of Human immunovirus HIV infections in conjunction with other antivirals

contraindications.disease: Acute overdose Inadvertent pediatric overdoses have occurred with doses up to 1 5 mg kg zalcitabine Chronic overdose in an initial dose finding study in which zalcitabine was administered at doses 25 times 0 25 mg kg every 8 hours the currently recommended dose one patient discontinued zalcitabine after 1½ weeks of treatment subsequent to the development of a rash and fever
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Zalcitabine is an analog of 2 deoxycytidine that is pharmacologically related to but structurally different from other nucleotide reverse transcriptase inhibitors NRTIs Zalcitabine inhibits the activity of HIV 1 reverse transcriptase RT both by competing with the natural substrate dGTP and by its incorporation into viral DNA

incompatibilities.description: Ribavirin may increase the hepatotoxic activities of Zalcitabine
The risk or severity of cytopenia can be increased when Ganciclovir is combined with Zalcitabine
The risk or severity of cytopenia can be increased when Valganciclovir is combined with Zalcitabine
